LederPlug: Consigue la expansión de Los Cachivaches de Leder Games!

BotSetup.PriorityMarkers: Establece los marcadores de prioridad para el mapa
BotSetup.TurmoilText: Si no puedes colocar un nido, caes en el caos
BotSetup.TurmoilNobilityText: Si no puedes colocar un nido o un guerrero, caes en el caos

Electric Eyrie.Setup0: Forma la reserva de guerreros (20) junto a ti.
Electric Eyrie.Setup1: Coloca 1 nido y 6 guerreros en el claro de la esquina diagonalmente opuesta al claro donde está la ficha de fortaleza. Si el Marquesado no juega esta partida, coloca dichas piezas en el claro de cualquier esquina al azar.
Electric Eyrie.Setup3: Coge los 6 nidos restantes y colócalos junto a ti.

Vagabot.Setup0: Coloca tu peón de Vagabot en el bosque que esté adyancente a más claros. Si hay varios de esos bosques, elige cuál al azar entre esos.
Vagabot.Setup1: Baraja el mazo de misiones, roba una carta de misión y colócala bocarriba junto a ti. Esta misión sólo puede ser completada por este bot.
Vagabot.Setup2: Coloca un objeto cualquiera marcado como "R" debajo de cada ruina del mapa.
Vagabot.Setup3: Coge 4 objetos cualesquiera marcados con una "S" y colócalos en tu hatillo _(el Chatarrero empieza con 3 objetos en vez de con 4 objetos)_.

Automated Alliance.Setup0: Forma la reserva de guerreros (10) cerca de ti.
Automated Alliance.Setup1: Coge tus 3 bases y colócalas cerca de ti.
Automated Alliance.Setup2: Coge tus 10 fichas de simpatía y colócalas cerca de ti.

Mechanical Marquise.Setup0: Forma la reserva de guerreros (25) junto a ti.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup1: Coloca la ficha de fortaleza en el claro de una esquina al azar.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup2: Coloca un guerrero en cada claro excepto en el claro que está en la esquina diagonalmente opuesta al claro de la ficha de fortaleza. Coloca un guerrero adicional en el claro con la ficha de fortaleza _(coloca 12 guerreros en total)_.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup3: Coloca 1 aserradero, 1 taller y 1 reclutador al azar entre los claros con la ficha de fortaleza y los claros adyacentes, con un máximo de un edificio en cada claro.
Mechanical Marquise.Setup4: Coge los 15 edificios restantes y colocalos junto a ti.

Electric Eyrie (DC).Setup0: Forma la reserva de guerreros (20) junto a ti.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Setup1: Coloca 1 nido y 6 guerreros en el claro de la esquina diagonalmente opuesta al claro donde está la ficha de fortaleza. Si el Marquesado no juega esta partida, coloca dichas piezas en el claro de cualquier esquina al azar.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Setup3: Coge los 6 nidos restantes y colócalos junto a ti.

Vagabot (DC).Setup0: Coloca tu peón de Vagabot en el bosque que esté adyancente a más claros. Si hay varios de esos bosques, elige cuál al azar entre esos.
Vagabot (DC).Setup1: Baraja el mazo de misiones, roba una carta de misión y colócala bocarriba junto a ti. Esta misión sólo puede ser completada por este bot.
Vagabot (DC).Setup2: Coloca un objeto cualquiera marcado como "R" debajo de cada ruina del mapa.
Vagabot (DC).Setup3: Coge 4 objetos cualesquiera marcados con una "S" y colócalos en tu hatillo _(el Chatarrero empieza con 3 objetos en vez de con 4 objetos)_.

Automated Alliance (DC).Setup0: Forma la reserva de guerreros (10) cerca de ti.
Automated Alliance (DC).Setup1: Coge tus 3 bases y colócalas cerca de ti.
Automated Alliance (DC).Setup2: Coge tus 10 fichas de simpatía y colócalas cerca de ti.

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup0: Forma la reserva de guerreros (25) junto a ti.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup1: Coloca la ficha de fortaleza en el claro de una esquina al azar.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup2: Coloca un guerrero en cada claro excepto en el claro que está en la esquina diagonalmente opuesta al claro de la ficha de fortaleza. Coloca un guerrero adicional en el claro con la ficha de fortaleza _(coloca 12 guerreros en total)_.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup3: Coloca 1 aserradero, 1 taller y 1 reclutador al azar entre los claros con la ficha de fortaleza y los claros adyacentes, con un máximo de un edificio en cada claro.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Setup4: Coge los 15 edificios restantes y colocalos junto a ti.

Electric Eyrie.Easy: Durante la preparación añade sólo un Visir Leal al Decreto.
Electric Eyrie.Challenging: Durante la preparación, toma una emboscada de ave del mazo y añádela a la columna de ave del Decreto.
Electric Eyrie.Nightmare: Durante la preparación, toma una emboscada de ave del mazo y añádela a la columna de ave del Decreto. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria.

Vagabot.Easy: Por la Noche refresca un objeto menos.
Vagabot.Challenging: Por la Noche refresca un objeto adicional.
Vagabot.Nightmare: Por la Noche refresca un objeto adicional. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria.

Automated Alliance.Easy: **Organizas** en los claros que tengan cuatro o mas guerreros de la Alianza.
Automated Alliance.Challenging: **Organizas** en los claros que tengan dos o mas guerreros de la Alianza.
Automated Alliance.Nightmare: **Organizas** en los claros que tengan dos o mas guerreros de la Alianza. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria.

Mechanical Marquise.Easy: Cuando **reclutes**, en vez de lo normal, recluta sólo dos guerreros.
Mechanical Marquise.Challenging: Cuando **reclutes** coloca además dos guerreros en el claro ordenado que gobiernes de mayor prioridad.
Mechanical Marquise.Nightmare: Cuando **reclutes** coloca además dos guerreros en el claro ordenado que gobiernes de mayor prioridad. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria.

Electric Eyrie (DC).Easy: Cuando **reclutes** en ave coloca un guerrero menos.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Challenging: Cuando **reclutes** en ave coloca un guerrero adicional.
Electric Eyrie (DC).Nightmare: Cuando **reclutes** en ave coloca un guerrero adicional. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria por cada dos jugadores (redondeado hacia arriba).

Vagabot (DC).Easy: Por la Noche refresca un objeto menos.
Vagabot (DC).Challenging: Por la Noche refresca un objeto adicional.
Vagabot (DC).Nightmare: Por la Noche refresca un objeto adicional. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria por cada dos jugadores (redondeado hacia arriba).

Automated Alliance (DC).Easy: **Organizas** en los claros que tengan cuatro o mas guerreros de la Alianza.
Automated Alliance (DC).Challenging: **Organizas** en los claros que tengan dos o mas guerreros de la Alianza.
Automated Alliance (DC).Nightmare: **Organizas** en los claros que tengan dos o mas guerreros de la Alianza. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria por cada dos jugadores (redondeado hacia arriba).

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Easy: Cuando **reclutes**, en vez de lo normal, recluta sólo tres guerreros.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Challenging: Cuando **reclutes**, en vez de lo normal, recluta cinco guerreros.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Nightmare: Cuando **reclutes**, en vez de lo normal, recluta cinco guerreros. Al final de la Noche obtén un punto de victoria por cada dos jugadores (redondeado hacia arriba).

SpecificRules.TextPoorManualDexterity: No tienes mano de cartas. No puedes descartar cartas. Si un humano tuviera que robarte una carta, en vez de eso la roba del mazo. Si un humano tuviera que darte una carta, la descarta y tu obtienes **vp:1**.
SpecificRules.TextHatesSurprises: No se pueden usar cartas de emboscada contra ti.
SpecificRules.TextLordsOfTheForest: Gobiernas cualquier número de claros en los que estés empatado en presencia.
SpecificRules.TextNobility: Ahora caes en el **caos** si no puedes colocar un nido o un guerrero. Cuando caigas en el **caos** no pierdes puntos de victoria. En vez de eso obtienes un punto de victoria por cada carta de ave que haya en el Decreto.
SpecificRules.TextRelentless: Después de resolver el Decreto retira todos los edificios y fichas indefensas enemigas de un claro cualquiera con guerreros del Nido.
SpecificRules.TextSwoop: Al final del Día coloca dos guerreros en el claro de mayor prioridad que no tenga ninguna pieza del Nido.
SpecificRules.TextWarTax: Cuando retires un edificio enemigo o una ficha enemiga, su propietario pierde un punto de victoria.
SpecificRules.TextLoneWanderer: Tu peón no es un guerrero y no puede ser retirado del mapa. Si un efecto enemigo indica que se retiran todas las piezas enemigas de tu claro, dañas tres objetos.
SpecificRules.TextNimble: Puedes moverte sin importar quien gobierna tu claro
SpecificRules.TextAdventurer:
Sólo puedes **batallar** una vez por turno.
Al final del día repite la acción de **misión** tantas veces como puedas.
SpecificRules.TextBerserker:
Cuando **batalles**, en vez de lo normal, muévete al claro más cercano que tenga más piezas y elige como objetivo al jugador que tenga mas piezas allí.
Por la Noche repara un objeto adicional.
SpecificRules.TextHelper: Cuando **ayudes** obtén un punto de victoria adicional, y el jugador al que ayudes roba dos cartas en vez de una.
SpecificRules.TextHelperDC: Cuando **ayudes**, si no hay objetos disponibles, muévete para ayudar al jugador con menor puntuación, agota un objeto para obtener **vp:1**. El jugador al que ayudes roba una carta.
SpecificRules.TextMarksman: Al comienzo de una batalla como atacante, da un golpe inmediatamente _(obteniendo un punto de victoria si retiras un guerrero enemigo)_.
SpecificRules.TextAutomatedAmbush: Como defensor en batalla, si tienes al menos un guerrero de la Alianza, das un golpe adicional.
SpecificRules.TextAutomatedOutrage: Cuando un humano retire una ficha de simpatía o mueva guerreros a un claro afín, ese jugador debe descartarse de una carta correspondiente al claro. Si no puede, obtienes **vp:1**.
SpecificRules.TextMartialLaw: Cuando coloques una ficha de simpatía en un claro con tres o más guerreros del mismo jugador enemigo, obtén un punto de victoria menos _(con un mínimo de cero)_.
SpecificRules.TextCrackdown: Cuando se retire una base, retira todas las fichas de simpatía de los claros correspondientes a la base que se retira.
SpecificRules.TextCrackdownDC: Cuando se retire una base, devuelve todas las fichas de simpatía de los claros correspondientes a la base que se retira.
SpecificRules.TextInformants: Como defensor en batalla en un claro con ficha de simpatía indefensa, das un golpe adicional.
SpecificRules.TextPopularity: Los enemigos no obtienen puntos de victoria por retirar fichas de simpatía
SpecificRules.TextPopularityDC: Los enemigos sólo pueden obtener un punto de victoria por turno por retirar fichas de simpatía.
SpecificRules.TextVeterans: Obtén la habilidad de Guerra de Guerrillas de la Alianza del Bosque. _(como defensor en batalla, tú utilizas la tirada más alta y el atacante la tirada más baja)_.
SpecificRules.TextVeteransDC: Como defensor en batalla, utilizas la misma tirada del atacante. _(ambos jugadores utilizan la tirada más alta para determinar los golpes)_.
SpecificRules.TextWildfire: Al final de la Noche **extiende simpatía**. No obtienes puntos por colocar esta ficha de simpatía.
SpecificRules.TextTheKeep: Sólo tú puedes colocar piezas en el claro con la ficha fortaleza.
SpecificRules.TextBlitz: Después de mover, indentifica el claro que gobiernes de mayor prioridad sin piezas enemigas. Mueve todos tus guerreros excepto uno desde ese claro a uno adyacente. A continuación, batalla en el claro de destino.
SpecificRules.TextFortified: Tus edificios requieren cada uno dos golpes durante la misma batalla para ser retirados. Si recibes un único golpe con un edificio, no tiene efecto alguno.
SpecificRules.TextHospitals: Al final de la batalla como defensor, si dos o mas guerreros del Marquesado fueron retirados en la batalla, coloca dos guerreros en el claro con la ficha de fortaleza.
SpecificRules.TextHospitalsDC: Al final de la batalla como defensor, si dos o mas guerreros del Marquesado fueron retirados en la batalla, coloca un guerrero en el claro con la ficha de fortaleza.
SpecificRules.TextIronWill: Cuando **reclutes** durante el Día Potenciado, coloca el doble de guerreros.
SpecificRules.TextIronWillDC: **Repite el Día** puede suceder dos veces por turno en lugar de una sola vez.

Electric Eyrie.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Electric Eyrie.DecreeOrder: Add the order card to the matching Decree column.
Electric Eyrie.NewRoost: Place a roost and 4 warriors in the ordered clearing of the highest priority where all those pieces can be placed. _(Intentionally not listed on board.)_

Vagabot.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Vagabot.RestOrder: If you have two or fewer undamaged items, move to a random adjacent forest, then go to Evening.

Automated Alliance.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Automated Alliance.Revolt: Remove all enemy pieces from the **card:{{suit}}** sympathetic clearing with the most enemy pieces, and place the **card:{{suit}}** base there.
Automated Alliance.RevoltSpread: If you did not revolt, **Spread Sympathy** {{sympathySpread}}.

Mechanical Marquise.CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.

Electric Eyrie (DC).CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Electric Eyrie (DC).DecreeOrder: Add the order card to the matching Decree column.
Electric Eyrie (DC).NewRoost: Place a roost and 3 warriors in the ordered clearing of the highest priority where all those pieces can be placed. _(Intentionally not listed on board.)_

Vagabot (DC).CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Vagabot (DC).RestOrder: If you have two or fewer undamaged items, move to a random adjacent forest, then go to Evening.

Automated Alliance (DC).CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.
Automated Alliance (DC).Revolt: Remove all enemy pieces from the **card:{{suit}}** sympathetic clearing with the most enemy pieces, and place the **card:{{suit}}** base there.

Mechanical Marquise (DC).CraftOrder: Craft order card for **vp:1** if it shows an available item.

Electric Eyrie.Recruit:
Recruit {{totalForSuit}} warrior(s) in a {{suitText}} clearing with a roost. {{recruitText}}
_(**Ties**: Recruit in such a clearing with the most enemy pieces, then fewest Eyrie warriors, then lowest priority.)_
Electric Eyrie.Move:
Move from the {{suitText}} clearing you rule with the most of your warriors to an adjacent clearing. Leave enough warriors to exactly rule the origin clearing or {{totalForSuit}}, whichever is higher.
_(**Destination Ties**: Move to such a clearing with no roost, then fewest enemy pieces, then lowest priority.)_
Electric Eyrie.Battle:
Battle in a {{suitText}} clearing against the player with the most buildings there. {{extraHit}}
_(**Clearing Ties**: Battle in such a clearing with no roost, then most defenseless buildings, then lowest priority.)_
_(**Defender Ties**: Battle such a player with the most pieces there, then the player with the most victory points.)_
Electric Eyrie.ExtraDecree: You should have added at least 2 bird cards to the decree.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraRelentless: Remove all defenseless tokens and buildings in any clearing with Eyrie warriors.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraRecruit: If you cannot place a warrior, you fall into turmoil.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraBuild: Place a roost in the clearing you rule of highest priority with no roost. If you cannot place a roost, you fall into turmoil.
Electric Eyrie.ExtraSwoop: Place two warriors in the clearing of highest priority with no Eyrie pieces.

Vagabot.ActionExplore: Move to the nearest ruin, exhausting one item per move, then exhaust one item to take an item from that ruin.
Vagabot.ActionQuest: Move to the nearest clearing matching the quest, then exhaust any two items to discard the quest and score **vp:1**. _(Ignore card text.)_ Then, replace the quest.
Vagabot.ActionQuestRepeat: Repeat this as many times as possible.
Vagabot.ActionAid: Target the player in your clearing with any items and the least VP among those players. Exhaust as many items as possible up to the number of items they have, take that many items from them, and score {{aidHelpText}}that many VP. Then, they draw {{aidHelpText}}that many cards.
Vagabot.ActionBattle: Move to the nearest clearing with any pieces of the enemy with the most {{target}}, then exhaust one item to battle that player. Score **vp:1** per enemy warrior removed.
Vagabot.ActionBattleAdventurer: Repeat this action, exhausting two items per extra battle, as many times as possible.
Vagabot.ActionBattleMarksman: Deal an immediate hit in each battle.
Vagabot.ActionBattleTiebreaker: _(If target defender is in multiple clearings at equal distance, move to clearing where they have most buildings and tokens, then fewest warriors.)_
Vagabot.ActionRepair: If you have any damaged items, exhaust one item to repair one damaged item, unexhausted before exhausted.
Vagabot.ActionSpecial: Exhaust one item to do the following (skip if it would have no effect):

Automated Alliance.Sympathy:
Place a sympathy token in the **card:{{suit}}** clearing with the fewest enemy warriors adjacent to any sympathetic clearing.
(**No Such Clearings**: Instead place a sympathy token on the clearing with the fewest enemy pieces.)
(**Cannot Spread**: If you cannot place a sympathy token, score 5 VP.)
Automated Alliance.Revolt: Remove all enemy pieces from any sympathetic clearing with the most enemy pieces, and place the corresponding base there.

Mechanical Marquise.Blitz: Find the clearing you rule of the highest priority without any enemy pieces. Move all but one warrior from the clearing. Then, battle in the destination clearing.
Mechanical Marquise.Bird0: Battle in all clearings. _(Defender is the player with most pieces, then victory points.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Bird1: Recruit {{warriorsOverTwo}} warrior(s) in each of the two clearings you rule with lowest priority. If you only rule one clearing, place all {{totalWarriors}} warriors there.
Mechanical Marquise.Bird2:
Build a building of the type with the most pieces on the map in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise Warriors.
_(On a tie between sawmills and any other building types, place a sawmill. On a tie between workshops and recruiters but not sawmills, place a recruiter.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Bird3: Move all but three of your warriors from each clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces. Then battle in each clearing you moved into.
Mechanical Marquise.BirdChallenging: Place two warriors in the ordered clearing you rule of the highest priority.
Mechanical Marquise.Suit0: Battle in each **card:{{suit}}** clearing. _(Defender is the player with most pieces, then victory points.)_
Mechanical Marquise.Suit1: Recruit {{totalWarriors}} warriors evenly spread across **card:{{suit}}** clearings you rule. If there are extra warriors that cannot be placed evenly in **card:{{suit}}** clearings, place the last warrior in the **card:{{suit}}** clearing with the highest priority.
Mechanical Marquise.Suit2: Build a **building:{{building}}** in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise warriors.
Mechanical Marquise.Suit3: Move all but three of your warriors from each **card:{{suit}}** clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces.
Mechanical Marquise.Repeat: If you did not place a building this turn and have five or fewer buildings on the map, discard the order card, draw a new one, and repeat Daylight.

Electric Eyrie (DC).Recruit:
Recruit {{recruitNum}} warrior(s) in a {{suitText}} clearing with a roost. {{recruitText}}
_(**Ties**: Recruit in such a clearing with the most enemy pieces, then fewest Eyrie warriors, then lowest priority.)_
Electric Eyrie (DC).Move:
Move from the {{suitText}} clearing you rule with the most of your warriors to an adjacent clearing. Leave enough warriors to exactly rule the origin clearing or {{totalForSuit}}, whichever is higher. Do not consider clearings in which no warrior would move.
_(**Destination Ties**: Move to such a clearing with no roost, then fewest enemy pieces, then lowest priority.)_
Electric Eyrie (DC).Battle:
Battle in a {{suitText}} clearing. {{extraHit}}
_(**Clearing Ties**: Battle in such a clearing with no roost, then most defenseless buildings.)_
_(**Defender Ties**: Battle such a player with most buildings there, then the player with then most pieces there.)_
Electric Eyrie (DC).ExtraDecree: You should have added at least 2 bird cards to the decree.
Electric Eyrie (DC).ExtraRelentless: Remove all defenseless tokens and buildings in any clearing with Eyrie warriors.
Electric Eyrie (DC).ExtraRecruit: If you cannot place a warrior, you fall into turmoil.
Electric Eyrie (DC).ExtraBuild: Place a roost in the clearing you rule of highest priority with no roost. If you cannot place a roost, you fall into turmoil.
Electric Eyrie (DC).ExtraSwoop: Place two warriors in the clearing of highest priority with no Eyrie pieces.

Vagabot (DC).ActionExplore: Move to the nearest ruin, then exhaust one item to take an item from it.
Vagabot (DC).ActionQuest: Move to the nearest clearing matching the quest, then exhaust any two items to discard the quest and score 2 VP. _(Ignore card text.)_ Then, replace the quest.
Vagabot (DC).ActionQuestRepeat: Repeat this as many times as possible.
Vagabot (DC).ActionAid:
Move to the nearest clearing containing pieces of a player with any items if possible. Then, exhaust one item to take one of their items and place it in your satchel. Score **vp:1** and then they draw a card.
_(**Player Tie**)_: if multiple players have pieces in equal distance, select the player with the lower score.
Vagabot (DC).ActionBattle: Move to the nearest clearing with any pieces of the enemy with the most {{target}}, then exhaust one item to battle that player. Score **vp:1** per enemy warrior removed.
Vagabot (DC).ActionBattleAdventurer: Repeat this action, exhausting two items per extra battle, as many times as possible.
Vagabot (DC).ActionBattleMarksman: Deal an immediate hit in each battle.
Vagabot (DC).ActionBattleTiebreaker: _(If target defender is in multiple clearings at equal distance, move to clearing where they have most buildings and tokens, then fewest warriors.)_
Vagabot (DC).ActionSpecial: Exhaust one item to do the following (skip if it would have no effect):

Automated Alliance (DC).Sympathy:
Place a sympathy token into an unsympathetic adjacent clearing adjacent to any sympathetic clearing.
(**Clearing Tie**: Avoid clearings with 3 or more warriors of a single player, then place in **card:{{suit}}** clearing.)
(**Cannot Spread**: If you cannot place a sympathy token, score 5 VP.)
Automated Alliance (DC).SympathyBird:
Place a sympathy token into an unsympathetic adjacent clearing adjacent to any sympathetic clearing.
(**Clearing Tie**: Place into the lowest priority clearing.)
(**Cannot Spread**: If you cannot place a sympathy token, score 5 VP.)
Automated Alliance (DC).Revolt: Remove all enemy pieces from any sympathetic clearing with the most enemy pieces, and place the corresponding base there.
Automated Alliance (DC).RevoltSpread: If you did not revolt, **Spread Sympathy** {{sympathySpread}}.

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Blitz: Find the clearing you rule of the highest priority without any enemy pieces. Move all but one warrior from the clearing. Then, battle in the destination clearing.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Bird0: Battle in all clearings. _(Defender is the player with most pieces, then victory points.)_
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Bird1: Recruit {{totalWarriors}} warrior(s) evenly among the two lowest priority clearings you rule. If you rule only one clearing, place all {{totalWarriors}} there. Score **vp:1** for every two warriors that could not be recruited.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Bird2:
Build a building of the type with the most pieces on the map in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise Warriors.
_(On a tie between sawmills and any other building types, place a sawmill. On a tie between workshops and recruiters but not sawmills, place a workshop.)_
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Bird3: Move all but three of your warriors from each clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces. Then battle in each clearing you moved into.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit0: Battle in each **card:{{suit}}** clearing. _(Defender is the player with most pieces, then victory points.)_
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit1:
Recruit {{totalWarriors}} warriors evenly spread across **card:{{suit}}** clearings you rule. Score **vp:1** for every two warriors that could not be recruited.
_(**Clearing tie**: Place warriors into clearings with highest priority first.)_
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit2: Build a **building:{{building}}** in a clearing you rule with the most Marquise warriors.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).Suit3: Move all but three of your warriors from each **card:{{suit}}** clearing to the adjacent clearing with the most enemy pieces. Each warrior may only move once during this action.

Vagabot.Refresh: If you have any damaged items, refresh {{itemRefreshMin}} undamaged items. If you have none, refresh {{itemRefreshMax}} instead.
Vagabot.Forest: If you are in a forest, repair all items. If not, repair {{itemRepairs}} item(s). Repair unexhausted items before exhausted items.

Automated Alliance.Organize: In each clearing with a base and {{organizeVal}} or more Alliance warriors, remove all Alliance warriors there and **Spread Sympathy**.
Automated Alliance.WarriorPlace: Place a warrior in each clearing with a base.
Automated Alliance.Wildfire: **Spread Sympathy**, but do not score victory points.

Electric Eyrie (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (redondeado hacia arriba).

Vagabot (DC).Refresh: Refresh {{itemRefreshMin}} items. If you have no damaged items, refresh {{itemRefreshMax}} instead.
Vagabot (DC).Forest: If you are in a forest, repair all items. If not, repair {{itemRepairs}} item(s). Repair unexhausted items before exhausted items.
Vagabot (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (redondeado hacia arriba).

Automated Alliance (DC).Organize: In each clearing with a base and {{organizeVal}} or more Alliance warriors, remove all Alliance warriors there and **Spread Sympathy**.
Automated Alliance (DC).WarriorPlace: Place a warrior in each clearing with a base.
Automated Alliance (DC).Wildfire: **Spread Sympathy**, but do not score victory points.
Automated Alliance (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (redondeado hacia arriba).

Mechanical Marquise (DC).Repeat: If you did not place a building this turn and would score less than 3 victory points, discard the order card, draw a new one, and repeat Daylight. This may only happen once per turn.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).RepeatIronWill: If you did not place a building this turn and have five or fewer buildings on the map, discard the order card, draw a new one, and repeat Daylight. This may only happen twice per turn.
Mechanical Marquise (DC).NightmareScore: Score **vp:1** for every two players (redondeado hacia arriba).

Electric Eyrie.YesNobility: Score one victory point per bird card in the Decree.
Electric Eyrie.NoNobility: Lose one victory point per bird card in the Decree.

Vagabot.DescTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, scoring **vp:1**. _Start the game with one fewer item._
Vagabot.SpecialTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, scoring **vp:1**.
Vagabot.DescThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot.SpecialThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot.DescRanger: If you have three or more damaged items, slip into a random adjacent forest.
Vagabot.SpecialRanger: If you have three or more damaged items, slip into a random adjacent forest.
Vagabot.BattleTrack3: Maximum rolled hits: 3; as attacker, deal 1 extra hit.

Electric Eyrie (DC).YesNobility: Score one victory point per bird card in the Decree.
Electric Eyrie (DC).NoNobility: Lose one victory point per bird card in the Decree.

Vagabot (DC).DescTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, gaining no points. _Start the game with one fewer item._
Vagabot (DC).SpecialTinker: Search the discard pile for the top card with an available item and craft it, gaining no points.
Vagabot (DC).DescThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot (DC).SpecialThief: Take a random card from the enemy in your clearing with most points there, then most pieces there.
Vagabot (DC).DescRanger: If you have any damaged items, repair one damaged item, unexhausted before exhausted.
Vagabot (DC).SpecialRanger: If you have any damaged items, repair one damaged item, unexhausted before exhausted.
Vagabot (DC).BattleTrack3: Maximum rolled hits: 3; as attacker, deal 1 extra hit.
